v.v: You are my covenant faithfulness and my fortress,
Yahweh, what is man that you take notice of him
Cause the sky to sink and come down, Yahweh;
Send flashes of lightning and scatter my enemies;
Reach out your hand from above;
I will sing a new song to you, God;
Rescue me and free me from the hand of foreigners.
May our sons be like plants who grow to full size in their youth
May our storehouses be full with every kind of produce,
Then our oxen will have many young.
Blessed is the people with such blessings;

v: who trains my hands for war
and my fingers for battle.
my high tower and the one who rescues me,
my shield and the one in whom I take refuge,
the one who subdues nations under me.
or the son of man that you think about him?
his days are like a passing shadow.
touch the mountains and make them smoke.
shoot your arrows and drive them back in confusion.
rescue me out of many waters,
from the hand of foreigners.
and their right hand is falsehood.
on a lute of ten strings I will sing praises to you,
who rescued David your servant from an evil sword.
Their mouths speak lies,
and their right hand is falsehood.
and our daughters like carved corner pillars, shapely like those of a palace.
and may our sheep produce thousands and ten thousands in our fields.
No one will break through our walls; there will be no exile
and no outcry in our streets.
happy is the people whose God is Yahweh.
